definition: A feeling of intense unease, often accompanied by a sense of impending doom or danger. It is commonly used to describe a deep-seated fear or anxiety that can be experienced in various situations, such as before an important event, during times of uncertainty, or when facing a specific phobia.

examples.german: Sie hat große Angst vor Prüfungen.
examples.english: She has a great fear of exams.

examples.german: Er verspürt Angst vor der Dunkelheit.
examples.english: He feels fear of the dark.

examples.german: Angst kann zu körperlichen Symptomen führen.
examples.english: Fear can lead to physical symptoms.

examples.german: Die Angst vor dem Unbekannten ist weit verbreitet.
examples.english: The fear of the unknown is widespread.
